indications.text: rapiblyk indicated short-term reduction ventricular rate adults supraventricular tachycardia including atrial fibrillation atrial flutter .

contraindications.text: administer intravenous infusion monitored setting . ( 2.1 ) titrate according ventricular rate . ( 2.1 ) normal cardiac function , start 9 mcg/kg/min ; adjust dose 10-minute intervals needed increments 9 mcg/kg/min maximum 36 mcg/kg/min . ( 2.1 ) impaired cardiac function , start 1 mcg/kg/min ; adjust dose 15-minute intervals needed increments 1 mcg/kg/min maximum 36 mcg/kg/min . ( 2.1 ) .

warningsAndPrecautions: rapiblyk supplied white almost white , preservative-free , lyophilized powder single dose vials containing 280 mg landiolol injection ( equivalent 300 mg landiolol hcl ) . vial supplied carton ndc 84381-110-01
adverseReactions: rapiblyk contraindicated patients : severe sinus bradycardia , sick sinus syndrome , heart block greater first degree [ ( 5.2 ) ] . decompensated heart failure [ ( 5.3 ) ] . cardiogenic shock : may precipitate cardiovascular collapse cause cardiac arrest . pulmonary hypertension : may precipitate cardiorespiratory decompensation . hypersensitivity , including anaphylaxis , landiolol inactive ingredients
name: RAPIBLYK
indications_original: RAPIBLYK is indicated for the short-term reduction of ventricular rate in adults with supraventricular tachycardia including atrial fibrillation and atrial flutter.
contraindications_original: Administer as an intravenous infusion in a monitored setting. ( 2.1 ) Titrate according to ventricular rate. ( 2.1 ) If normal cardiac function, start at 9 mcg/kg/min; adjust dose in 10-minute intervals as needed in increments of 9 mcg/kg/min to a maximum of 36 mcg/kg/min. ( 2.1 ) If impaired cardiac function, start at 1 mcg/kg/min; adjust dose in 15-minute intervals as needed in increments of 1 mcg/kg/min to a maximum of 36 mcg/kg/min. ( 2.1 ).
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
RAPIBLYK is supplied as a white to almost white, preservative-free, lyophilized powder in single dose vials containing 280 mg landiolol for injection (equivalent to 300 mg landiolol HCl).
                        Each vial is supplied in a carton NDC 84381-110-01
adverseReactions_original:
RAPIBLYK is contraindicated in patients with:
                  
                     Severe sinus bradycardia, sick sinus syndrome, heart block greater than first degree 
   [see Warnings and Precautions (
                        5.2
                        )].
  
                     Decompensated heart failure 
   [see Warnings and Precautions (
                        5.3
                        )].
  
                     Cardiogenic shock: May precipitate further cardiovascular collapse and cause cardiac arrest.
                     Pulmonary hypertension: May precipitate cardiorespiratory decompensation.
                     Hypersensitivity reactions, including anaphylaxis, to landiolol or any of the inactive ingredients
